Articles.Content: Excellent shot of the decouple there, even if the cams were slightly out of sync :/
Loved the RCS on the first stage! Awesome!
I was able to see the rocket from my house
That was an awesome stage separation! Love the RCS firing!
Could see the RCS first stage starting to turn it around!
i've heard Stage 1 splashdown in the webcast - mmmh ?

oh dangit my stream froze up just after they announced stage one splashdown! what did i miss?

Also, that swirling fuel picture needs to be made into a gif
When they say splashdown, do they mean controlled landing into the water or did they just let the thing fall?
Falcon 9 splashed down hard and was destroyed.
@ techpriest93 nothing - they just announced that the second upper stage burn was quite some time away and cut the webcast
that was awesome! My first ever seeing a live Falcon 9 launch.
Perfect, textbook launch And awesome view of the rocket - i've never seen first stage separation and fairing jettisoning from the groundside. Thank the Mighty Thor for excellent weather conditions

that was awesome! My first ever seeing a live Falcon 9 launch.

Same, although my computer froze up during the launch and I had to switch over to my phone, missing the first bit of it!

Part count must of been too high.

Wish they showed more of the first stage after separation :/

http://www.spacex.com/press/2015/02/11/dscovr-launch-update

here's the answer for 'stage 1 splashdown' : extreme weather at recovery site, + the drone recovery platform only has 3 engines out of 4 working (hard to stationkeep) so they only tried a controlled sea softlanding.
Absolutely the most beautiful launch I've ever seen. Go check out the NASA stream for replays from various camera angles.
Was really confused by the clock flashing yellow? Apparantly Falcon 9 is too much for the universe to simulate in real time?
Some pics I managed to take during the launch.
Any more info on the first stage splashdown? I heard landed hard. Did something go wrong again?
Nice pictures! Now only to find out about the "soft" landing on the ocean surfaceÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

Did something go wrong again?

The chances of the first stage making it safely were <1%.

Any more info on the first stage splashdown? I heard landed hard. Did something go wrong again?

They just dropped it into extreme weather, so I think that was expected.

Falcon 9 splashed down hard and was destroyed.

Where are you getting new updates? I'm following on Twitter and NASA TV and never heard anything.

Was really confused by the clock flashing yellow? Apparantly Falcon 9 is too much for the universe to simulate in real time?

It has quite a few parts so the physics engine probably struggles a bit. We'll have to wait for an update...

Where are you getting new updates? I'm following on Twitter and NASA TV and never heard anything.

He hit F3.

- - - Updated - - -

Still waiting for official word on the first stage soft landing. Also awaiting an update on the second stage and DSCOVR.

He hit F3.

On what page? Twitter, Spaceflight Now, NASA TV and SpaceX do not show any new information (except for imminent second stage relight).

Update:

Just heard confirmation on good second stage ignition and burn.
